subject: Law
title: The Electoral College: Still Debated
description: A quick, practical guide to The Electoral College: Still Debated.

hook.text: Five US presidents won office while losing the popular vote. The Electoral College made that possible.

buildup.text: The founders created the Electoral College as a compromise between popular vote and congressional selection.

discovery.text: Each state gets electors equal to its congressional delegation. Winner-take-all rules amplify swing state power.

twist.text: Abolishing it needs a constitutional amendmentâ€”nearly impossible. A state compact offers a workaround.

climax.text: Supporters say it protects smaller states. Critics say it distorts democracy and ignores millions of voters.

punchline.text: The system was a compromise in 1787. It's still one.

quiz.question: How many presidents won office while losing the popular vote?
